meanings.definition: relating to or affected with keratosis
meanings.sent1: Her keratosic skin condition required special treatment.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with a keratosic skin disorder.
meanings.sent3: Despite his keratosic hands, he was an excellent pianist.
meanings.sent4: The old tree bark had a keratosic texture, rough and thick.
meanings.sent5: The keratosic patches on her elbows were as hard as stone.

meanings.sent1: The keratosic cream helped treat the rough patches on her skin.
meanings.sent2: The keratosic growth on the plant needed to be removed.
meanings.sent3: The keratosic lotion made her skin feel like sandpaper.
meanings.sent4: The keratosic condition of the patient's feet required regular care.
meanings.sent5: The keratosic areas on the tree trunk were a sign of disease.

meanings.sent1: The keratosic structure of the hair made it strong and durable.
meanings.sent2: The keratosic material in the nails provided protection.
meanings.sent3: The keratosic fibers in the fabric made it tough and resilient.
meanings.sent4: The keratosic nature of the horn made it sturdy and unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The keratosic layer on the skin acted as a barrier against harm.
